results.title: The Swimming Pool
results.brief_description: Our hero looks forward with great anticipation to enjoying his new swimming pool, only to be thwarted at every turn. The pool becomes a magnet for trespassing children, sailboats, a spaceship complete with astronauts, a thirsty elephant and a ten-car pile-up. In utter frustration he gives up, fills in the pool and plants a tree-only to be hit on the head by a falling apple

In utter frustration, he gives up, fills in the pool and plants a tree - only to be hit on the head by a falling apple. Written by Bruno Bozzetto.

results.title: The Swimming hole
results.creator_credit: Skeets McGrew and King Screen Productions
results.brief_description: Seemingly a story of a teenage farmboy who has come to the river to fish, this wordlessfilm takes on a deeper meaning, opening out into an allegory on humans and their relationship to the environment. It makes the point that we must understand the delicate natural balance before attempting to interfere with it.

results.title: The Swedish fokus
results.creator_credit: John Miller, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: A film study of the Fokus flats at Taby, Stockholm, it examines how far these specially-designed apartments have liberated handicapped people from their physical constraints. Peter Large, who has himself been disabled by a polio attack, talks to the Swedish tenants about their living environment and opportunities.

results.title: The Sweater
results.creator_credit: Sheldon Cohen, David Verrall, Derek Lamb, Marrin Canell and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: An animated version of a short story by Quebec author Roch Carrier, set in the rural Quebec of his childhood. Carrier recalls the passion for playing hockey which he shared with other boys of his community. It was the time of Rocket Richard, the Canadians’ greatest star. A funny, poignant story animated in a style that evokes the period of the late 1940s. Awards: fifteen including Ottawa; Calgary; Yorkton; Toronto; New York; London; Les Menuires. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The Swarming hordes
results.creator_credit: Christopher Parsons, David Attenborough, John Sparks, Richard Brock and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life on Earth”
The history of the insects and their amazing interdependence and co-evolution with the plants that support them.

group_siblings.title: Life in the trees

results.title: The Swans of Abbotsbury
results.brief_description: A pictorial description of the famous swannery of Abbotsbury in Dorset. Over 500 pairs of swans dwell in the grounds of the ancient Benedictine Monastery of Abbotsbury, and in the pleasant acres leading to the river banks the graceful birds live and rear their young; shows the parent birds at their nest, and the appearance of the fledglings.

results.title: The Survivalists
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tuesday Documentary”.
Over two million Americans are preparing themselves for some form of major disaster - nuclear war, imminent social breakdown, unavailability of food or even world wide cataclysm. This program, filmed all over the U.S., looks at the ‘survivalists’ who are leaving the cities for the country and the desert.

results.title: The Surveyors level
results.brief_description: Discusses the theory and practice of levelling, with particular regard to the steps necessary to check and to maintain instruments in a proper state of adjustment. The latter section of the film illustrates the use of the Geodetic Level and finally how this level was used by the Geodetic Survey of Canada to run out a hundred miles of control levels along the Red River.

results.title: The Surf boats of Accra
results.creator_credit: Sydney Latter and Editorial Film Productions
results.brief_description: For over 500 years the surf boats of Accra have carried cargoes ashore. Today this old practice is dying out but there are still some crews left. We see the skill and strength of the men as they drive their boats back and forth through the pounding surf competing with each other for the loads of cargo.
